result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Anthony Masciola

records.addlTxt: Notice of hearing for the final pretrial and jury trial printed with mailing address of Mr. Masciola to the county jail.  He has been released so the JA mailed the notices to Mr. Masciola at the address listed on the case.
Final pre-trial on January 20, 2023 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial on February 7, 2023 at 08:30 am.
of Prelim on 7/28/22
and Motion to Expand Time Limits for Filing Pretrial Motions

Atty Curran has not received the Information but State advises the charges mirror the Complaint.  Atty Curran waives reading and stands mute.  DE advised of charges and penalties.  Court enters Not Guilty Plea.  Matter reset.

11:07 AM Defendant Michael Anthony Masciola in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael C. Curran in court for Michael Anthony Masciola.  Attorney Natalia J Gess in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court starts to go through waiver of prelim form.  Recess at 11:09 AM.  Back on the record at 11:10 AM.  DE is satisfied that the medications he is taking are not affecting his ability to waive the prelim freely, knowingly and voluntary.  Atty Curran agrees.  Court accepts the waiver and finds same to be free, knowing and voluntary.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on October 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael Anthony Masciola
Current: 303 12th Ave., Baraboo, WI 53913 United States  (Effective: 08-05-2022)
Prior: E11713 Gall Rd, Baraboo, WI 53913

9:49 AM Prosecuting attorney Natalia Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Anthony Masciola in court.  Attorney Michael C. Curran in court for Michael Anthony Masciola.  Court states case and appearances.  Court notes Atty Curran was just appointed today as he was unaware of today's hearing.  Court notes time limits were not waived so the prelim must proceed today.  State provides Atty Curran a copy of the complaint.  Atty Curran requests the PH be set over and the civil matter be addressed.  Court notes as there has been no time limit waiver she must proceed unless the DE now wishes to waive the time limits.  Atty Curran talks to DE and then states they will waive the time limits for the PH.  DE agrees.  Court accepts time limit waiver.  Court goes off the record to address scheduling.  Back on the record, the Court makes record re: upcoming proceedings for this DE.  Firearms surrender hearing (civil matter) to be heard at the same time as the PH.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Anthony Masciola appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes appeared by video for Michael Anthony Masciola. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE needs to contact PD's office to see if he qualifies.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  Time limits NOT waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends $150 cash bond.  Atty Hayes recommends a signature bond.  DE updates address.  $150.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with S.A.M., her residence or place of employment.  DE may return one time, upon prior notice and with LE to retrieve any personal belongings.
